TopicTitle: [AAR] The Grand Tour - Voyage To The Planets

Articles.Content: Guys I suggest you read this chapter again carefully, it actually sheds some light on the Duna mystery
I didn't read the ending yet, but did the Proteus crash on Eeloo? If it did, I have a nice little teaser sequel animation script for that...
Knew berty was taking proteus to Eeloo...

Note that, like in all movies, events are reconstructed to suit audience's attention.

[screen is black. Radio static is heard in background after ONE second, slowly fading in. Subtitles appear in bottom-left corner: EELOO - PROTEUS]

[RADIO begins calling any crew remaining as the interior of the communication sector fades into view. Nobody answers. Fade out VIDEO and AUDIO]

[TWO second pause]

[Jeb] Well, they finally shut up, huh, BERTY?

[bERTY] Affirmative

[Fade in pilot section. Jeb is sitting at the controls, punching in commands.]

[Jeb] I've been thinking, BERTY. Do the Kethane drills still work?

[RAPID CLICKING and BEEPING for several seconds]

[bERTY] Affirmative. Kethane Attribution Apparatus at 85% integrity.

JEB smiles.

[Jeb] Very good, BERTY. Now, are you still interested in the mission?

[bERTY] The mission is complete.

[Jeb] No, BERTY. The mission is never complete. No-

[bERTY] I do not understand. All planets were acquired. The mission is complete.

[Jeb] I meant the mission of science as a whole.

[bERTY] Explain.

[Jeb] Well, you were designed to do scientific studies of planets, correct?

[bERTY] That is correct. All planets were acq-

[Jeb] Will you be quiet!

[TWO second pause]

[Jeb] Here's what I've been thinking. Do you see all of the stars out there, BERTY?

[bERTY] Yes. Instruments detect several stars. They are of similar composition to-

[Jeb] Koddammit, BERTY! Listen to me! Those stars, they have planets, yes? And science is never over, so...

[slight pause]

[bERTY] Course plotted. New destination: Kalpha Centuria.

[Jeb] There you go!

[slight pause]

[bERTY] Fuel tank integrity: 72%. Fuel levels critical. Ignition impossible.

[Jeb] You said that the K.A.A. still worked.

[bERTY] Affirmative.

[CAMERA switches to outside of PROTEUS. Many doors open in the hull, revealing bore-head drills. They extend into EELOO's surface, and jets of KETHANE begin to erupt around them.]

[bERTY] Kethane acquired. Fuel conversion initiated. Fuel levels: 30%. 40%. 50%. 60%...

JEB laughs.

[Jeb] Go, BERTY!

[bERTY] ...80%. 90%. 100%. Engine integrity: 89%. Operational. Ignition confirmed.

[OUTSIDE view of PROTEUS. Engines ignite, PROTEUS begins to rise slightly. Very slowly, PROTEUS gains altitude. CAMERA switches to control room.]

[bERTY] Destination plotted: Kalpha Centuria.

[PROTEUS ignites main engines, and tilts to vertical, engines kicking up ice as PROTEUS accelerates upward. One star in the sky becomes brighter than the others for ONE second before scene begins to fade, leaving that star as the sole object on the screen.]

[screen goes black, subtitles (CENTER): The Grand Tour: New Horizons]

[Fade out]
The whole "America and Russia trying to get to a lost spacecraft to find out what happened" reminds me of this.

The whole "America and Russia trying to get to a lost spacecraft to find out what happened" reminds me of this.

Czok takes a lot of plot ideas and mixes them into one hell of a story.

I've just realised, the two nations attempting to get to a abanond/lost ship...

2010: odyssey two, any one?

I've just realised, the two nations attempting to get to a abanond/lost ship...

2010: odyssey two, any one?

Just look at the past posts.....

Just look at the past posts.....

*sorry* *frowny face *
Oh sure it's going to start out 2010, but lets face it, it will rapidly descend to Event Horizon before too long.

Well, after far too many late nights this week, I finally finished The Grand Tour. Magnificent work - just magnificent.

Very much looking forward to Book III when it comes - and why do I have the feeling that Rozer is due for this own HAL / BERTY moment? He's a patriot but also rational to a fault and I'm thinking that the words of his President are not sitting too comfortably with BERTY's assessment of the USK.
Hopefully the last part of this trilogy will be much better looking. All in .26 and maybe with the astronomer visuals pack or something like that...

Hello there,

I've had a busy week IRL, sorry for no response. Traditionally I'll answer to all your comments - for the last time I'll try to do this today.

Some updates concerning my future plans may follow soon.

Take care,

czoklet

Basically this - I just need some break from KSP it seems, I didn't play it in weeks. I still owe you response to your comments, I didn't forget about it - I'll try to put myself together and do it finally Soon

And yes, in fact I had the basic outline of the story in March/April 2013 - and with AAR completed in May 2014 that means I was planning some things for >12 months. The hardest thing was to not say anything, especially when some of you guessed some pieces of the plot correctly.

Still, he's not dead. That would have been depressing.

Yeah, I guess I wouldn't really enjoy it

For those who are interested - my CK2 AAR is revived and there are two new chapters already avaible.

Just saying

Edited June 7, 2014 by czokletmuss

Hello, czokletmuss. I just wanted to say: thanks. This story was an amazing read, from start to end, and is deserving of official publishing as a book based on KSP. This has inspired many people (including me) to start our own stories; however, I can predict that very few of them will reach this quality.

Thank you Although it took more than 12 months to complete the story, hearing that it's interesting and enjoyable to read still makes me happy Considering that 0.24 release is coming (albeit not really fast) I guess I should slowly start preparing for the last part of the series. By this I mean thinking about the plot, some planning etc. It depends on what 0.24 brings of course but I think I'll probably wait for 0.25 before starting the third AAR.

Take care,

czoklet
Czo, I just wanted to thank you for bringing us the best AAR ever. I'm sure the next one will be even better!
